channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tarmac around the pot hole broken, 28th January
item.description:
The tarmac around the man hole is broken up and the manhole is noisy when the cars go across them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The temporary lights have been placed 25 yards from a signalled road junction, cars are jumping the junction lights in order to go through the temporary lights when on green. Prioviously road works sround north upton labe gave resulted in 4 way lightc to includevthe Greenways traffic junction. This is now not the case, so when exiting Greenways on a green light cars are constantly having near misses with cars not stoppingat a red light on barnwood road. Wales and west refuse to accept there is a safety issue. The tempirary lights need to be moved to the junction of Greenways and have the main junction light tutned off to allow safe exit for Greenway residents, 28th January
item.description:

item.title: Dangerous slab is a hazard to pedestrians, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, London Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Large tree/roots causing a mound in the pavement, 28th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Severe flooding after rain, 28th January
item.description:
This never used to flood. Flooding is so bad now that it is now impassable for pedestrians following heavy rain as you cannot see the pavement. The flood water covers both sides of the road so you cannot see where the road ends and the pavement kerb begins - so you don't know where to drive until the water subsides and you can follow the cats eyes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 28th January
item.description:
2 potholes outside our car port 0.5 metre long 3.5". Tarmac and hardcore is being flicked up onto our vehicles.
Report on FixMyStreet
